com.intel.util.instrumentation

Class SystemCmdExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.instrumentation.SystemCmdExecutor

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class SystemCmdExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to help launch a system command For example, running the Linux top command, or to cat the /proc/meminfo virtual file

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String NEW_LINE_STRING

      • NEW_LINE_STRING

        @NonNull
public static final java.lang.String NEW_LINE_STRING

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemCmdExecutor

        public SystemCmdExecutor(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String binary,
                         @Nullable
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments)
        Creates a wrapper for a system command to be run. For example, to run the top command with: - 1 update - immediate output - 6 most CPU intensive processes final ArrayList topArgs = new ArrayList<>(); topArgs.add("-n"); topArgs.add("1"); //NON-NLS topArgs.add("-d"); topArgs.add("0"); //NON-NLS topArgs.add("-m"); topArgs.add("6"); //NON-NLS final SystemCmdExecutor topCmdExec = new SystemCmdExecutor("top", topArgs); //NON-NLS final String output = topCmdExec.execute();
        Parameters:
        binary - The command binary to run
        arguments - The command line arguments, if any, to supply to the binary

    • Method Detail

      • executeCommand

        @Slow(value=SECONDS)
 @WorkerThread
public void executeCommand(@NonNull
                                                               java.io.Writer writer)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the command and writes the result using the provided Writer instance.
        Parameters:
        writer - The writer that will write the result.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO exception occurred when reading or writing the result.

      • executeCommand

        @Slow(value=SECONDS)
 @WorkerThread
 @NonNull
public java.lang.String executeCommand()
                                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the command and returns the result as a String.
        Returns:
        The execution output as a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO exception occurred when reading or writing the result.
